title: Why does the Boards Over React to Everything?
body:
This new mechanic of targeted spells drawing minion aggro. 

I've been maining GP for forever and his Q draws aggro. Ive played with it for 2 years never had an issue playing around it. They normalize it for everybody and all of the sudden minions do 300 damage an auto and are going to nuke your ass if you throw a pantheon Q at someone lmao

Downvote me all you want but it is true. This will have an impact but barely. 

Melee Champions for the most part have had to deal with this forever, so I see 0 issue in ranged champions having to as well.

replies.body: While the boards do tend to overreact i'm just glad they say their opinion about what they think needs to be changed about the game and whats wrong with it(unlike reddit :I ) I, personally, am overjoyed that pantheon/teemo's q now draws aggro, cause laning against them as fiora was horrid, this helps a little bit.

When someone says their opinion and a sugestion on how to fix it that is good criticism but most of those comments never see the light of day beacuse someone posted OMG THIS GAME IS **** I QUIT then proced to rage about the things they dont like and dont give any comment sugestion or anything on how to fix  the issue or just say delete that i dont like it and people upvote those posts.

I mean, I can't suggest a rework for someone like {{champion:80}} when I don't know what Riot wants for him. I can give you a rework idea, plenty of people have done so, but until Riot says something I see no point. 

Now, if Riot said, "We want Pantheon to be a melee bruiser who scales into late game with high mobility and no CC" then I could do something.
HOW DARE YOU HAVE AN OPINION THAT IS AGAINST US
because we're attentive to detail

It is being over analyzed.

Melees have been dealing with this since forever. Ranged champs can deal with it too
Ah, but that doesn't mean that they should.

Yes it does. Ranged champions already have an inherent advantage of being ranged. The ability to harass without punishment is overkill. If a melee champion wants to trade with a teemo they have to soak minion aggro just to get on him while the teemo can just pound his face in and minions won't even look at him. 

It is completely fair and a great addition by Riot.
Ranged champions barely even have targeted spells. And before it was more holistic, whereas as now it is a complication of pure mechanic.
Yep, be a boards monkey and pretend minions do 800,000 damage and it is fair for a Pantheon or Teemo to constantly fuck you through your minions and not have to even think twice

Be a cancer activist and pretend overcomplicated design is good because it utterly defeats the purpose of Teemo and Pantheon, who are harass midgame champions, because they can outrade you because you have no control of distancee

They can out trade you because they have spammable, undodgeable abilities that give you no choice. You walk up for cs and eat the harass or you miss the CS to preserve your health.

Wow such intuitive gameplay.

God forbid the champion has to actually think about harassing instead of slamming his keys of cooldown

In all fairness; Panth and teemo should be able to consistently "fuck you through your minions and not have to even think twice". Thats their design. This change isnt the way to deal with it, and a teemo Q and panth Q shouldnt draw minion agro, as they are abilities, not auto attacks, where as GP Q should as its technically an auto attack. If you want panth or teemo to not be so oppressive, then they need an actual kit adjustment.

Not to mention the other guy had a point; melee champs are hurt by this more than ranged, as more melee have single targets than ranged.

If they are running Comet/Aery, then this change will affect them a lot IMO. If they are running Grasp/Footwork, then it won't. Not saying other keystone runes aren't good on those champs, but those are the ones that pop out as the most relevant to the discussion.
psst, theres this thing called basic attacks, yeah, ranged champs have em, crazy, right?!?
They're not spells, crazy, right?????????????????
not to mention, wait for this, you won't believe it: they can do more damage than lot's of spells! :O

not to mention, wait for this, I was talking about ranged champions barely having targeted spells (not basic attacks)

and not to mention, wait for it, rangers are specialized in harass so they should have basic attacks and spells for harass
Although they're meant to harass some of them tend to reach a point of unfairness. Like laning against pantheon as fiora, he could Q me all game without me being able to do much, making lane unfun.

Second step is contributing to the pace so that he is out of line when you engage minions by noting his position and either feinting him or outracing him to the minion by attacking during his minion attack, the first step is not playing fiora since she is useless cancer

except it's rather hard for him to be out of line as his q has a decent range and can't miss. Fiora may not be the greatest at the moment but she isn't useless nor is she cancer, I enjoy playing her so I shall continue doing so.

Okay. Do that.

Pantheon's q is medium-short range, but it's strong. But just like he can shoot it, you can dodge it since it requires timing.
you can't dodge it..... and even then it's cooldown is fairly low. parrying it would just be plain stupid as her parry cooldown is five times as long as his q.
Not to say I don't agree with the change, but melees tend to get compensated through health, resistances, and kit numbers.

but they don't. 
Many melees have worse early base stats than ranged champs.

Teemo's auto's were never immune to minion aggro. If he had only been using his Q to poke he won't be doing much damage anyways. This change will hardly effect teemo since he had to deal with it anyways.

This isn't a matter of ranged vs melee really.  A lot of melee champions are going to be hit by this more than the ranged champs (primarily Pantheon and Kassadin).  These two champions had a lot of lane strength in being able to throw out poke without repercussion.

Now this likely won't completely warp their laning, they will have to be more cautious about it.

This is pretty fair, it's annoying when someone spams abilities at you and minions don't care at all while I as {{champion:268}}  if barely poke laner with soldier, entire minion wave goes insane and rushes me through all allied minions.
okay so i started to pick up azir again today and i literally have no idea: Did his soldiers aggro minions BEFORE the change today? I really cannot remember that at all.
Yes

Who plays Azir anyway? Trash Champ of you ask me.

Top class midlaner atm. Not really what I'd call trash.

You're sadly mistaken pal.

No, I am right, and you are wrong. Obviously, in bronze the azirs you see are not very good, I can understand that.

I disagree wholeheartedly. 

Bud.
No one is overreacting about this.
This is why I chill in Memes & Games. People always have something to complain about in Gameplay.

But I keep seeing that everyone that is not a tank is struggling. And that riven is in a very bad spot. That’s all I’m saying.

Maybe I’ll just play the lane I want with the champion I want and not care what the boards say. I’ve never played Maoki a day in my life and everyone says he’s the only good top laner now.
Yup
Because #SaveTheCane

People in general don't overreact. All the negative threads on the boards are just a very small percentage of people who got angry enough to whine on the internet. Most people just don't care, or like the change.
Sheep mentality.
Just like people behave like sheep to whatever Riot decides?

Yes. But that's definitely not me. If anything, I'm usually against a lot of things Riot decides because i don't have blind faith in them. That's Riot's problem, they don't like criticism. Whether it's constructive or worst.
That and they don't like creativity
